[h1]One of the best games, managed by one of the worst companies.[/h1]

The game is well-polished; it feels nice to play, looks good, and actually does the "[b]Hero Shooter[/b]" part [b]really well[/b]. Even though the new devs have been trying to blind us with Ramattra's Annihilation and Illari's Captive Sun, the game still is visually appealing considering the amount of actions that it has.

That being said, the ultimate killer of fun in this game is, [i]surprise surprise[/i], the balancing.

If you play this game for a season or two and actively read the patch notes, you are going to learn two things real quick:

1. Certain heroes receive buffs [b]and then get stripped of those buffs in around 2 updates[/b], sometimes even with additional nerfs which make them worse than before.

2. Certain heroes are just never touched, even though they're the current meta / suffering from the worst pick rate.

It is clear to me that devs want every hero to play unique and therefore, have different abilities, but that comes with the problem of "[i]if you want to have a chance against the other team, you have to play X[/i]". This statement itself is valid, but in the current meta it doesn't matter what you play as tank, [b]you're not going to have a good time[/b], because there is absolutely nothing you could do against a team that is playing around their surroundings and teammates. The problem then becomes an American-Chopper-Argument.jpg where the team is asking tank to take space, but the tank can't put the shield down so they ask the team to get a pick first but the team also couldn't because there's no space.

Contrary to the popular take of "bring 6v6 back", I actually prefer the 5v5 new standard, but they have to figure out a way to make the tank role playable, or the match experience is just going to be terrible for everyone involved.

Gameplay problem aside, there's also the problem with Blizzard's integrity as a company. Before Overwatch 2 came out, Overwatch 1 had to endure 4 years of no-new-contents only to hear about the PvE cancellation, which is the main reason as to why Overwatch 1 stopped updating. I for one do not care about PvE in the slightest, but even I would be hesitant to play a game from a company with that on its record.

At its current state, I would not recommend Overwatch 2 to people who want a competitive game, because it simply hasn't been one for a while; on the other hand, if you are mature enough to know how to take Ls and not tilt from your teammates, I think it is worth checking out because while I complain a lot about it, Overwatch 2 really is one of a kind.

Como persona que lleva bastantes aÃ±os jugando al juego lo recomiendo. El gameplay es dinamico, variado y ahora al salir el 2 tiene multiples escenarios, modos y mas contenido del que ofrecia siendo el 1 y heroes de ese tipo no te lo ofrecen de la misma forma otros juegos lo cual a mi parecer lo hace un juego unico en lo suyo, tambien no es dificil que vaya fluido ya que con una grafica muy de gama baja que tenia anteriormente me corria sin problemas.
Los unicos problemas que veo es que Blizzard intenta cobrarte hasta por respirar y eso hace que en parte se quiten muchas ganas de jugar ya que todo se consigue pagando practicamente y las recompensas gratuitas son muy meh. Obviamente como juego online tambien tiene el problema de que va a haber spamers, heroes rotos, partidas frustrantes y dias donde juegues y te vas a querer cortar los huevos y no volver a saber mas del juego porque el emparejamiento es MUY EQUISDE y te tocan compaÃ±eros que no saben agarrar el raton vs el equipo enemigo lleno de jugadores profesionales que te van a humillar de todas las formas posibles.

Mi conclusion es que lo juegues con colegas, minimo uno por rol (un colega que vaya tanque, otro dps y otro healer) y si los otros 2 randoms la lian almenos os podeis centrar y organizar entre vosotros. Prueba todos los heroes hasta que aprendas que hacen y como funcionan aunque no te guste, va a ayudarte y mainea varios personajes variados para adaptarte a las situaciones y sobre todo para divertirte. Si te echas 3 partidas (en ranked sobre todo) y las pierdes deja de jugar o haz otra cosa, quierete porque eso en ranked te hara bajar como un tiro toda la tarde, ve a normales o sal y despejate.
